intro: Ampelocissus xizangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan grape ivy, is a climbing vine native to China. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
